flights.Key_Evidence: • Indicates something (equipment/aircraft) still occupying the gate area that must be physically moved before UAL872 can park. | • Presence of a SuperTug confirms active tow operations in the ramp – a key indicator of a delayed tow-off scenario. | • Shows ongoing effort to clear remaining equipment from gate G10; confirms gate not yet available. | • Gate area still blocked by tug/cart—direct evidence that delayed removal of towed equipment is preventing parking. | • Confirms the blocking tug has to be re-positioned (tow-off) before UAL872 can be marshalled in, making late tow-off the root cause of the 40-minute taxi-in time.

Evidence_Details.message: we need the company to move back a couple of feet because of equipment behind the lines for us, so it should be just a couple minutes.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Indicates something (equipment/aircraft) still occupying the gate area that must be physically moved before UAL872 can park.

Evidence_Details.message: SuperTug Foxtrot 11, East, MOC, under tow.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Presence of a SuperTug confirms active tow operations in the ramp – a key indicator of a delayed tow-off scenario.

Evidence_Details.message: the equipment within Golf 10 on the left has been removed, if you guys see something else, we can let us know.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Shows ongoing effort to clear remaining equipment from gate G10; confirms gate not yet available.

Evidence_Details.message: there's still a tug in the corner right next to where the last engine would be and a cart next to it that are over the line.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Gate area still blocked by tug/cart—direct evidence that delayed removal of towed equipment is preventing parking.

Evidence_Details.message: Apparently that tug is in ops, so they're going to tow us in. We've still got the engines running, you'll let us know when we can shut them.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Confirms the blocking tug has to be re-positioned (tow-off) before UAL872 can be marshalled in, making late tow-off the root cause of the 40-minute taxi-in time.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms the aircraft could not taxi to gate because another aircraft was still at F9. | • Shows the blocking aircraft was NOT late; it left early/on-time. Therefore delay is not due to late departure or any other operational issue. | • Schedule variance exceeds ±15 min threshold, meeting criteria for ‘Early Arrival’. Because the gate was still legitimately occupied by a not-late departing flight, the early arrival is the root cause.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms SKW5617 has landed and is requesting taxi to its assigned gate E5. | • Controller tells SKW5617 the gate will not be available for another 35 minutes, indicating the aircraft arrived well ahead of the planned gate-open time. | • Crew acknowledges gate unavailability and is instructed to wait on taxiways, beginning the prolonged taxi-in hold. | • Nearly 40 minutes later the flight is still maneuvering while waiting for the gate to become free, showing delay is tied to original early arrival, not to any late departure or other issue. | • Confirms no late-departure or mechanical blockage; gate timing problem is purely because SKW5617 arrived 46 minutes early.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms the flight arrived 38 minutes earlier than the timetable – a pure schedule variance that automatically qualifies for the Early Arrival classification when no higher-priority operational cause is present. | • Shows the aircraft touching down and being assigned its gate well before its scheduled arrival window, reinforcing the early-arrival condition. | • Eliminates ‘Late Departure’ or compound Early-Arrival-and-Late-Departure possibilities; gate was free on time. | • Indicates some ramp/alley sequencing, but no specific root-cause (mechanical, tow, FAA, etc.) is cited; therefore the governing factor remains the large schedule lead-time.

Evidence_Details.message: Landing time 08:04 vs. scheduled arrival 08:42 → ‑38-minute schedule variance (meets ≥15-minute early-arrival threshold).
Evidence_Details.relevance: Confirms the flight arrived 38 minutes earlier than the timetable – a pure schedule variance that automatically qualifies for the Early Arrival classification when no higher-priority operational cause is present.

Evidence_Details.message: Southwest 3683 (ASR mis-read of SkyWest 4683), cleared to land … gate Echo 6.

Evidence_Details.message: Previous flight UAL1849 pushed back 08:24 (scheduled 08:25) → 1-minute early push, not a late departure.

Evidence_Details.message: Skyways 4683R, east line to the gate when able.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Controller explicitly references keeping the alley (regional F-pier area) open, indicating heavy ground congestion in the alley/taxi lanes used by SkyWest arrivals. | • Ramp controller is stopping pushbacks because inbound aircraft (such as SKW5313) need access, showing push-taxi conflicts creating congestion. | • Continued instructions to hold for ‘traffic in the alley’ confirm sustained congestion in the same alley SKW5313 must use to reach gate F8. | • Ramp advising another SkyWest aircraft of multiple inbounds (including SKW5313) and warning of delay – further evidence of alley saturation. | • 35 min after landing SKW5313 still seeking taxi clearance toward gate, confirming prolonged hold on surface rather than gate unavailability.

Evidence_Details.message: Ground, Southwest 1648, if we just sat here at the ramp until you choose to move, would that be fine?  –  I want to keep the alley open as much as possible...
Evidence_Details.relevance: Controller explicitly references keeping the alley (regional F-pier area) open, indicating heavy ground congestion in the alley/taxi lanes used by SkyWest arrivals.

Evidence_Details.message: 2367R, hold the push for inbound traffic, I'll call you back.

Evidence_Details.message: United 1678, ramp, hold your position for traffic in the alley, I'll call you back.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Continued instructions to hold for ‘traffic in the alley’ confirm sustained congestion in the same alley SKW5313 must use to reach gate F8.

Evidence_Details.message: Skywest 6394, just a heads up, I have traffic behind you and two inbounds touching down right now, so expect a few minutes.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Ramp advising another SkyWest aircraft of multiple inbounds (including SKW5313) and warning of delay – further evidence of alley saturation.

Evidence_Details.message: Ground, Skywest 5313, ... looking to go to Foxtrot 8.
Evidence_Details.relevance: 35 min after landing SKW5313 still seeking taxi clearance toward gate, confirming prolonged hold on surface rather than gate unavailability.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms the flight landed more than 15 minutes early, satisfying the schedule-variance criterion for Early Arrival. | • ATC immediately diverts the aircraft to a remote hold because its gate is still occupied, a direct consequence of arriving well before the planned gate-vacate time. | • Shows the blocking aircraft was NOT late; the gate was legitimately occupied until 08:26. Because SKW5676 touched down at 08:13 (13 min before gate release), the conflict results solely from SKW5676’s early arrival, not a late departure. | • Demonstrates the aircraft was still waiting off-gate more than 30 minutes after landing, consistent with holding for the gate to open.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Controller explicitly instructs UAL1116 to hold because its assigned gate (D15) is not yet available, indicating gate occupancy is the immediate cause of the hold. | • Confirms the blocking aircraft (UAL487) was still on gate D15 and only began pushback at 10:04, more than 15 minutes after UAL1116 was told to hold, validating that the gate was occupied during the delay. | • Shows the occupying flight departed on schedule; therefore the gate conflict was caused by timing overlap, not a late departure or other specific operational issue, fitting the ‘Gate Unavailable’ definition.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms Condition 1 of compound rule – flight arrived ≥15 min early, so it reached the airport long before its gate was scheduled to be free. | • Immediate post-landing hold shows gate D10 was still occupied; surface symptom triggered by arriving far ahead of schedule. | • Previous flight (UAL2281) at gate D10 is only beginning push sequence after UAL1756 has already landed, proving gate occupancy. | • First indication that UAL2281’s pushback is encountering problems, foreshadowing a late departure. | • Explicit operational issue delaying UAL2281; at this point it is already 8+ min past its scheduled 16:22 push and still on the gate.

Evidence_Details.message: Landing 16:09 vs. scheduled 17:05  ➔ 55-minute early arrival (-55.1-min schedule variance)

Evidence_Details.message: United 2281, please cancel the switch clearance, we have…
Evidence_Details.relevance: First indication that UAL2281’s pushback is encountering problems, foreshadowing a late departure.

Evidence_Details.message: We are having trouble with the tug, so cancel … pushback, United 2281.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Explicit operational issue delaying UAL2281; at this point it is already 8+ min past its scheduled 16:22 push and still on the gate.

Evidence_Details.message: United 2281 … then push on Alpha, approved.
Evidence_Details.relevance: UAL2281 is still on the gate about 16 minutes after its scheduled push, confirming ≥15-minute late departure (Condition 2).

Evidence_Details.message: United 1756 … Delta, cross runway 28L, contact ground.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Gate finally becomes available and UAL1756 is released from its hold, tying the delay directly to UAL2281’s late push.
